intro: Roemeria davisii, commonly known as Davis's roemeria, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
